subject: Home & DIY
title: Aerogel: The Lightest Solid Material on Earth
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Aerogel: The Lightest Solid Material on Earth.

hook.text: Aerogel is 99.8% air and the lightest solid on record. A human-sized piece can balance on a flower without crushing it.

buildup.text: Made by swapping liquid in a gel for air at supercritical conditions, aerogel keeps its structure but weighs nothing.

discovery.text: Its insulation is extraordinary: 1 cm of aerogel equals 4 cm of fiberglass. NASA uses it on Mars rovers.

twist.text: Aerogel crumbles under pressure. But flexible aerogel blankets now make it practical for pipes, walls, and clothing.

climax.text: Aerogel paint, windows, and panels are entering homes. Ultra-thin walls with superior insulation are becoming real.
